name: Al Emmo's Postcards from Anozira
description: The Mayor of Anozira wants to breathe some new life into his town and he needs you! Help Al Emmo and the locals bring tourists to Anozira! Explore the town and learn about the local stops and interesting areas as you use your Hidden Object skills to attract new people to the area and help local business survive.
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows ME or higher Processor: 1.2 GHz Memory: 128 MB RAM Graphics: 32-bit SVGA Video card DirectX: Version 6.0 Storage: 195 MB available space Sound Card: Digital sound card

reviews.review_text: This game has many flaws, but is still of good value to  hardcore  hidden-object game lovers, especially those who enjoy the world of Al Emmo.  There is no point-and-click adventuring, and the puzzles aren't especially challenging or interesting. The hidden object scenes are plagued with stylistic incoherence, low-rez objects that barely look like what they're supposed to be, and repetition.  However... there are a  lot  of hidden-object scenes, enough content to keep you busy for a good few hours. Again, if you don't absolutely love such games, you will likely hate this one.  I played as Koko, and can't get enough of him! He's hilarious!

It's a hoe down in the coal town as you get ready to squint your eyes off trying to figure out what in god's name the artist thinks real world objects look like in this ugly as sin hidden objects game! Marvel at the glorious 800x600 resolution! Who says you need to be able to SEE the things you want to click?   My eyes hurt.
